title: Highest Male Primary School Persistence
description: In 2020, Chile achieved a 100% persistence rate for male students reaching the last grade of primary school, showcasing the country's commitment to education.

title: Minimal Adolescent Male School Dropout Rate
description: As of 2022, only 0.11% of male adolescents in Chile were out of school, indicating a strong retention rate in lower secondary education.

title: Lowest Health Expenditure-Induced Poverty
description: In 2016, only 0.01% of Chile's population was pushed below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenses, reflecting effective health care policies.

title: Minimal UNFPA Financial Dependency
description: In 2017, Chile received $147,774 from UNFPA, indicating low dependency on international financial aid from this agency.
